means: 使惊跳，使大吃一惊( startle的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The second paragraph startled me even more than the first.
sentence.Network_cn: 第二段比第一段更让我吃惊。

sentence.Network_en: Lindbergh was startled at the ferocious depth of anti-British feeling.
sentence.Network_cn: 反英情绪之深之烈令林德伯格大为震惊。

sentence.Network_en: She was startled when Lisa popped up at the door all smiles.
sentence.Network_cn: 莉萨突然笑容满面地出现在门口时，她吓了一跳。

startle 惊跳startle displays 惊吓展示startle reflex 惊跳反射
惊跳反射（startle reflex）（Startle reflex）亦称moro反射，是动物被突发性的强感觉刺激诱发的一种防御性反射，表现为部及躯体肌肉的快速收缩， …
惊吓反射（STARTLE REFLEX）：在新生儿时期，若突然的大声音刺激，会引起手臂外展而叉部屈曲，手掌呈紧握拳状，这种惊吓反 …

entry.def: If something sudden and unexpected startles you, it surprises and frightens you slightly.

example.ex: Sorry, I didn't mean to startle you...
example.tran: 对不起，我不是故意想吓你一跳的。

means.word_mean: 1. excited by sudden surprise or alarm and making a quick involuntary movement;

sentences.sentence: "students startled by the teacher's quiet return"
"the sudden fluttering of the startled pigeons"

auth_sentence.content: It also startled some people in the State Department.
auth_sentence.res_content: It also startled some people in the State Department.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It also startled some people in the State Department.

auth_sentence.content: The unaccustomed sound of the old piano startled me.
auth_sentence.res_content: The unaccustomed sound of the old piano startled me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The unaccustomed sound of the old piano startled me.

auth_sentence.content: I was startled by a sudden tinkling sound.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was startled by a sudden tinkling sound.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was startled by a sudden tinkling sound.

Sentence.sentence: You would not be surprised if a stranger tried to shake hands when you were introduced, but you might be a little startled if they bowed, started to stroke you or kissed you on both cheeks.

sentences.en: There was a startled look on his face when the flash bulb went off.
sentences.cn: 闪光灯灭时，他脸上一副惊愕的表情。

sentences.en: A crowd of 2000 was startled near the end of the concert.
sentences.cn: 2000名观众在音乐会将近结束时大吃一惊。

jushi.english: Natalie looked at him with startled, excited eyes.
jushi.chinese: 娜塔莉以惊吓激动的目光瞧着他。

jushi.english: A startled look passed over his face.
jushi.chinese: 他脸上闪过吃惊的表情。

jushi.english: The decision turned the startled author into a media event.
jushi.chinese: 那个决定把受惊的作家变成了新闻焦点人物。
